content: row next row k3 k2tog k to last 5 sts k2tog tbl k3 patt pattern in st st front next row p rh right hand next row increase k3 m1 k to last 3 sts m1 k3 using a and 4mm needles cast on 50 54 58 62 sts and k 2 row repeat last 2 row until 16 16 20 20 sts rem rs right side cont in st st and increase 1 st at both ends of every foll 4th row until beg with a k row work in st st placing chart as foll rem remain ing 44 46 52 54 sts row 7 rs 19a 1b 3a 2b work to end of row using a left sleeve repeat repeat work 3 5 5 7 row straight ending after same stripe row as back cont to work from the chart next row k3 k2 decrease k to end of row st s stitch es so stripes will match and with rs facing for next row at the same time start the armhole shaping on row 41 43 47 49 next row cast off 4 4 5 5 sts at beg of row st st stocking stitch work the armhole shaping as for the back but until next row k3 k2tog k to end of row tbl through back loop shape raglan 22 24 26 28 sts rem next row cast off 4 4 5 5 sts at beg of row ws wrong side cast off 3 sts at beg of next 2 row 38 40 46 48 sts cast off cast off rem 6 6 8 8 sts for rium riatsala © right sleeve next row cast off 4 4 5 5 sts k to last 5 sts k2tog tbl k3 next row p next row cast off 4 4 5 5 sts k to last 5 sts k2tog tbl k3 next row p cast off rem 6 6 8 8 sts neckband join both front raglan seams and right back raglan seam using a and 3 75mm needles and with rs of work facing pick up and k 13 13 17 17 sts from left sleeve 20 22 24 26 sts from front 12 12 16 16 sts from right sleeve and 17 19 21 23 sts from back 62 66 78 82 sts cast off all sts loosely finish weave in any long ends gently steam work on reverse to give a great finish join left back raglan and neck seam sew side and sleeve seams knitting from a chart each square of the chart represents one stitch and each line of squares represents one row the rs row or odd numbered k row are read from right to left while the ws row or even numbered p row are read from left to right the row of the chart are read from the bottom to the top erika knight is a prominent knitwear designer and consultant to the fashion and yarn industries in collaboration
